Package it.polimi.ingsw.View.GUI.Application

Class ArchipelagoPane

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane
it.polimi.ingsw.View.GUI.Application.ArchipelagoPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObservableGUI, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class ArchipelagoPane extends javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane implements ObservableGUI
This class contains most of the game elements, except for those that are specific to players. The islands, clouds, characters, the student bag and the coin heap all go here. All the aforementioned elements except for the islands have their own container.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArchipelagoPane

      public ArchipelagoPane()
      Constructor for the archipelago. It creates all the elements which are ubiquitous to every match regardless of the number of players or game mode: 12 empty islands and empty containers for characters, clouds and bags.

  • Method Details

    • setObserver

      public void setObserver(ObserverGUI observer)
      Description copied from interface: ObservableGUI
      Sets the given observer to observe the GUI component.
      Specified by:
      setObserver in interface ObservableGUI
      Parameters:
      observer - the observer to set.

    • createIslands

      public void createIslands(int motherNatureIsland, List<Integer> islands)
      Sets an ID to each IslandTilePane based on the real ID in the server model, and places mother nature on the right island.
      Parameters:
      motherNatureIsland - the ID of the island that owns mother nature
      islands - the IDs of the island tiles in the server model

    • createClouds

      public void createClouds(int numOfPlayers, List<Integer> cloudIDs)
      Sets an ID to each CloudPane based on the real ID in the server model.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - the number of clouds in this game
      cloudIDs - the IDs of the clouds in the server model

    • createCharacterAndHeap

      public void createCharacterAndHeap(List<Integer> characterIDs)
      Sets the elements of the archipelago which are only used in a game in expert mode: three characters with their respective IDs and a coin heap.
      Parameters:
      characterIDs - the IDs of the characters in the server model

    • updateMotherNature

      public void updateMotherNature(int motherNatureIsland, List<Integer> islands)
      Updates all islands on the location of mother nature.
      Parameters:
      motherNatureIsland - the ID of the island that owns mother nature
      islands - a list of the islands' IDs

    • updateMovePower

      public void updateMovePower(int movePower, int motherNatureIslandGroup)
      Updates move power used to show which islands are selectable, along with the group occupied by mother nature
      Parameters:
      movePower - the current move power of the player
      motherNatureIslandGroup - the island group that contains mother nature

    • updateTowers

      public void updateTowers(HashMap<Integer,TowerColor> towers)
      Updates all islands on the presence (and color) of a tower on them.
      Parameters:
      towers - a hashmap with all the islands that have a tower on them and their associated color

    • updateNoEntry

      public void updateNoEntry(HashMap<Integer,Integer> noEntry)
      Updates all islands on the presence (and number) of no-entry tiles on them.
      Parameters:
      noEntry - a hashmap with all the islands that have a no-entry tile on them and their associated number

    • updateIslandStudents

      public void updateIslandStudents(HashMap<Integer,List<Integer>> islandsStuds, HashMap<Integer,Color> studsColor)
      Updates all islands on the presence, number and color of students on them.
      Parameters:
      islandsStuds - a hashmap with all the islands that have students and their associated IDs
      studsColor - a hashmap with all the students on the islands and their associated color

    • updateCloud

      public void updateCloud(int cloud, HashMap<Integer,Color> studs)
      Updates a single cloud on the presence, number and color of students on it.
      Parameters:
      cloud - the ID of the cloud to update
      studs - a hashmap with each student's ID and color on the cloud

    • updateBag

      public void updateBag(int studentsLeft)
      Updates the students bag with the remaining number of students inside it.
      Parameters:
      studentsLeft - the remaining number of students inside the bag

    • updateCharacter

      public void updateCharacter(int ID, boolean isActive, int usesLeft, HashMap<Integer,Color> newStuds, int numOfNoEntryTiles, boolean isOvercharged)
      Updates a single character with the given ID on the presence, number and color of students and (in the case of Character 4) the number of no-entry tiles on it.
      Parameters:
      ID - the character's ID
      newStuds - a hashmap with each student's ID and color on the character
      numOfNoEntryTiles - the number of no-entry tiles on the character

    • updateCoinHeap

      public void updateCoinHeap(int coinsLeft)
      Updates the coinheap with the remaining number of coins inside it.
      Parameters:
      coinsLeft - the remaining number of coins in the heap

    • updateMerge

      public void updateMerge(HashMap<Integer,List<Integer>> newIslandsConfiguration)
      Updates island groups, merging islands on the GUI if they have been merged in the server model.
      Parameters:
      newIslandsConfiguration - the current configuration of the islands inside island groups

      Enables the selection of any island in the archipelago.

    • calcMergeDiffMedian

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D calcMergeDiffMedian(int forwardIndex, int backIndex)
      Calculates the distance between the merging point of either of the two soon-to-be merged islands and the midpoint of their merging points.
      Parameters:
      forwardIndex - the index of the island that will move forward to merge
      backIndex - the island index of the island that will move backward to merge
      Returns:
      the coordinates representing the distance

    • calcMergeDiff

      public javafx.geometry.Point2D calcMergeDiff(int forwardIndex, int backIndex)
      Calculates the distance between the merging point of either of the two soon-to-be merged islands and the midpoint of their merging points.
      Parameters:
      forwardIndex - the index of the island that will move forward to merge
      backIndex - the island index of the island that will move backward to merge
      Returns:
      the coordinates representing the distance

    • relocateForward

      public void relocateForward(int index, javafx.geometry.Point2D mergeDiff)
      Animates the forwards motion of the island with the given index, by the amount specified in the given point.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the island to animate
      mergeDiff - the point that the island will reach in the animation

    • relocateBack

      public void relocateBack(int index, javafx.geometry.Point2D mergeDiff)
      Animates the backwards motion of the island with the given index, by the amount specified in the given point.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the island to animate
      mergeDiff - the point that the island will reach in the animation

    • createEmptyBridges

      public void createEmptyBridges()
      Now deprecated. Creates the invisible bridges around the island tiles.

    • setBridge

      public void setBridge(int forwardIndex, TowerColor bridgeColor)
      Now deprecated. Sets the visibility and color of a bridge connecting two islands.
      Parameters:
      forwardIndex - the index of the island from which the bridge is outgoing
      bridgeColor - the color of the bridge
